Method Detail

acquireMutexLock

java.lang.String acquireMutexLock(java.lang.String identifier, long mutexTimeout = DEFAULT_MUTEX_TIMEOUT, long pollTimeout = DEFAULT_POLL_TIMEOUT, long pollInterval = DEFAULT_POLL_INTERVAL)
Attempts to acquire a mutex lock for a given identifier.
Parameters:
identifier - Identifier of the mutex.
mutexTimeout - Amount of time the mutex lock is valid until it can be reacquired.
pollTimeout - Amount of time to wait for the mutex to become available.
pollInterval - Amount of time to wait before checking on the mutex availability.
Returns:
Mutex lock key required to release the mutex lock.

forciblyReleaseMutex

void forciblyReleaseMutex(java.lang.String identifier)
Releases a mutex without requiring the key. WARNING: THIS IS DANGEROUS This method should only be used as a last resort to restore stability in an application. The application logic should be robust enough so that processes that acquire a mutex have the proper error handling to release it to avoid weird application states where the mutex is no longer respected.
Parameters:
identifier

isMutexLocked

boolean isMutexLocked(java.lang.String identifier)
Determines if a mutex is currently locked.

isMutexLocked

protected boolean isMutexLocked(DistributedMutex mutex)
Determines if a mutex is currently locked.

releaseMutexLock

void releaseMutexLock(java.lang.String identifier, java.lang.String key)
Releases a mutex lock for a given identifier.
Parameters:
identifier - Identifier of the mutex.
key - Key required to unlock the mutex.

withTransaction

protected void withTransaction(boolean ifNotExpired = false, groovy.lang.Closure c)
Helper method to wrap a body of work with transaction error handling.
